intro: Tanacetum bipinnatum subsp. huronense, commonly known as Huron golden yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Great Lakes region of North America. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and wet meadows. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
